creator: dgurovich@seebeyond.com
text:
This problem is a "show stopper" on my current application!

Page renders first time fine.  When refreshing or returning back to page, 
throws error message at the end of this note (in this instance xtags are 
nested in Struts 1.1 application).  When I refresh the page again, it 
magically reappears!

Jim Strachan emailed me and said:

"Looks like <xtags:style> is closing the stream. It might be worth hacking the 
code and using a StringWriter instead of the underlying response.getWriter() 
so that when <xtags:style> does the close() (inside the XSLT engine) it 
doesn't close the underlying stream."

I looked around to hack this but couldn't find the "getWriter" method.  Other 
people may be having this problem anyway and it may be worth looking into.  I 
set an <%@page buffer="none"%> and the error goes away, but the page renders 
blank.  If I refresh again, the page reappears.  Jsp code AND Error Stack 
Follows, Thanks for any help or ideas:

jsp code___________________________________________________________

<xtags:style xsl="taskList/task-master.xsl">
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<taskRoot>
<xtags:style xml="preferences/xml/global-prefs.xml" xsl="taskList/task-
list.xslt" outputMethod="xml"/>
<bean:write name="xmlTasks" filter="false"/>
</taskRoot>
</xtags:style>
